posts.post_content:
It's a really nice effect; a creature with +0/+3 with vigilance can attack without worry and block almost anything. It's not worth paying 3, but the fact that it's a free artifact really helps make up for that. That, and it's an equipment so even if the creature dies, you lose the mana but not the card advantage.  
  
I give it 3.5 stars.
posts.html:
It's a really nice effect; a creature with +0/+3 with vigilance can attack without worry and block almost anything. It's not worth paying 3, but the fact that it's a free artifact really helps make up for that. That, and it's an equipment so even if the creature dies, you lose the mana but not the card advantage.

I give it 3.5 stars.

posts.post_content: Two of these and an [Origin Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Origin Spellbomb) on turn 1 set up my [Screeching Silcaw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Screeching Silcaw) mill victory. I placed 3rd in a draft on the back of this. On its own its alright, but with **any** [Metalcraft](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Metalcraft) creature its great.

posts.post_content:
Turn 2 [Plague Stinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Stinger) and equip this turn 3. Will probably win you a limited game since they can't block OR attack with anything that isn't infect even as large as a [Razor Hippogriff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Razor Hippogriff).  
  
Rough trying to find a place for it outside of limited with the equip of 3 though. 3 stars.

posts.post_content: Works Amazingly in my EDH. Between Protean Hydra, Engulfing Slagwurm and Borborygmos, it really helps keep up a steady pounding while not leaving myself vulnerable. Still, I would have prefer it if it costed mana to put out, and less to equip... 3.5/5

posts.post_content: Great equipment. It runs like an enchantment. You can drop it and equip it same turn without loosing any tempo.
